text: Edward Everett "Hook" Mylin (October 23, 1894 – June 19, 1975) was an American football player and coach of football, basketball, and baseball. He served as the head coach at Lebanon Valley College (1923–1933), Bucknell University (1934–1936), Lafayette College (1937–1942, 1946), and New York University (1947–1949), compiling a career college football record of 99–95–17. Mylin was also the head basketball coach at Lebanon Valley from 1923 to 1934 and the head baseball coach at Bucknell from 1935 to 1937. He was inducted into the College Football Hall of Fame as a coach in 1974. ==Playing career and education== Mylin attended Franklin & Marshall College, where he played football as a quarterback, was a member of the Chi Phi Fraternity, and graduated in 1916. ==Head coaching record== ===College football=== ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1894 births Category:1975 deaths Category:American football quarterbacks Category:Bucknell Bison baseball coaches Category:Bucknell Bison football coaches Category:Franklin & Marshall Diplomats football players Category:Iowa State Cyclones football coaches Category:Lafayette Leopards football coaches Category:Lebanon Valley Flying Dutchmen football coaches Category:Lebanon Valley Flying Dutchmen men's basketball coaches Category:NYU Violets football coaches Category:High school football coaches in Virginia Category:College Football Hall of Fame inductees Category:United States Army officers Category:American military personnel of World War I Category:Basketball coaches from Pennsylvania Category:People from Lancaster County, Pennsylvania Category:Players of American football from Pennsylvania
